what: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
title: Convert Files That Use palmerpenguins To Use datasets `penguins`
text: work--progress package. main functionality now place, fully-comprehensive test suite. Still : documentation. Convert scripts use palmerpenguins library use versions penguins penguins_raw datasets now R-devel, coming R 4.5. Palmer Penguins data become popular R community, especially educational contexts, alternative iris dataset. Including datasets R makes widely available, easier get started , especially new R users, use teaching. version penguins R’s datasets package shorter variable names palmerpenguins equivalent. differences : bill_dep instead bill_depth_mm bill_len instead bill_length_mm flipper_len instead flipper_length_mm body_mass instead body_mass_g changes made compact code data display. (e.g. printing penguins now shows columns 80 characters). mean, however, wanting use R’s version penguins, isn’t simply case removing call library(palmerpenguins) script still running. package provides functions take vector files (convert_files()) directory (convert_dir()), files specified extensions (default .R/.r/.qmd/.rmd/.Rmd ), remove calls library(palmerpenguins) replace long palmerpenguins variable names shorter R equivalents. also deals ends_with("_mm") (selector used palmerpenguins Get Started vignette). DETAILS SUBSTITUTION GIVEN GET STARTED VIGNETTE, WRITTEN. versions penguins_raw palmerpenguins datasets identical, expect former ’ll class tbl_df tibble package installed. specific changes made penguins_raw basepenguins, removing call library(palmerpenguins), datasets version used scripts, always data.frame (never tbl_df). Note palmerpenguins package provides features R, vignettes articles package website. package also contains data two csv files provides function access . , course, Allison Horst’s wonderful penguins artwork!

what: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: functions convert files use palmerpenguins package use versions penguins penguins_raw included datasets package R 4.5.0. removes calls library(palmerpenguins) make necessary changes variable names (see Details section ).

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
code: convert_files(input, output, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_files_inplace(input, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_dir(input, output, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))  convert_dir_inplace(input, extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"))

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: input convert_files() convert_files_inplace(): character vector file paths convert. convert_dir() convert_dir_inplace(): string path directory files convert. output convert_files(): character vector output file paths, NULL modify files place. provided, must length input. convert_dir(): string output directory, NULL modify files directory place. extensions character vector file extensions process, defaults R scripts R Markdown Quarto documents.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: invisible list two components: changed: named character vector output paths files modified, input paths names. not_changed: named character vector output paths files modified, input paths names. Files changed contain references palmerpenguins (.e. patterns) listed Details section, one specified extensions.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
text: Files converted : Replacing library(palmerpenguins) "" Replacing variable names: bill_length_mm -> bill_len bill_depth_mm -> bill_dep flipper_length_mm -> flipper_len body_mass_g -> body_mass Replacing ends_with("_mm") starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with(bill_) Non-convertible files (without specified extensions) copied output location output provided, modified. output files directory (yet) exist, created (recursively necessary). Replacing ends_with("_mm") starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with(bill_) ensures modified R code always run. starts_with("flipper_") intuitively necessary, one variable starting "flipper_", penguins, code error inside dplyr::(select), even flipper_len data frame (trying select flipper_len directly cause error column data frame). educational context, suggest manually editing converted files replace starts_with("flipper_") flipper_len appropriate. facilitate , functions documented produce message indicating files line numbers ends_with("_mm") made.

title: Convert files to use datasets versions of penguins and penguins_raw — convert_files
code: # Single file penguin_file <- penguins_examples("penguins.R") output_file <- withr::local_tempfile(fileext = ".R") result <- convert_files(penguin_file, output_file) #> - In /tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c2359ec268b.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. cat(readLines(output_file), sep = "\n") # view changes #>  #> library(ggplot2) #> library(dplyr) #>  #> # exploring scatterplots #> penguins |> #>   select(body_mass, starts_with("flipper_"), starts_with("bill_")) |> #>   glimpse() #>  #> # Scatterplot example 1: penguin flipper length versus body mass #> ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = flipper_len, y = body_mass)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species), size = 2) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "darkorchid", "cyan4")) #>  #> # Scatterplot example 2: penguin bill length versus bill depth #> ggplot(data = penguins, aes(x = bill_len, y = bill_dep)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = species, shape = species), size = 2) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "darkorchid", "cyan4")) #>  #> # With facets #> ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_len, y = body_mass)) + #>   geom_point(aes(color = sex)) + #>   scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange", "cyan4"), na.translate = FALSE) + #>   facet_wrap(~species)  # Convert multiple files to new locations input_files <- c(   penguins_examples("penguins.R"),   penguins_examples("analysis/penguins.qmd") ) output_files <- c(   withr::local_tempfile(fileext = ".R"),   withr::local_tempfile(fileext = ".qmd") ) result <- convert_files(input_files, output_files) #> - In /tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c231e1e6110.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents.  # Convert all files in a directory penguins_dir <- penguins_examples_dir() output_dir <- withr::local_tempdir() result <- convert_dir(penguins_dir, output_dir) #> - In /tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c2353187720/penguins.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - Remember to re-knit or re-render and changed Rmarkdown or Quarto documents. result$changed # see which files have changed #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd  #>                   "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c2353187720/analysis/penguins.qmd"  #>            /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R  #>                              "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c2353187720/penguins.R"   # Modify files in-place input_file <- penguins_examples("penguins.R")  # Copy file so don't overwrite example provided by package copy_path <- withr::local_tempfile(fileext = ".R") file.copy(input_file, copy_path) #> [1] TRUE convert_files_inplace(copy_path) #> - In /tmp/RtmpsF566S/file1c23747074a5.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files.  if (FALSE)  # don't overwrite the example files provided by the package   # Get all example files   input_files <- penguins_examples(recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)    # Convert them in place   convert_files_inplace(input_files) #> - In /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R, ends_with("_mm") replaced on line 7 - please check that the subsitution is appropriate. #> - Please check the changed output files. #> - what: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
text: function takes vector file paths returns vector modified paths prefixes /suffixes added filenames. useful generating output paths convert_files() convert_dir() functions. files_to_convert() useful generating input paths.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
text: paths character vector file paths modify prefix character string add beginning filename. Default "". suffix character string add end filename, extension. Default "_new". dir optional character string specifying output directory. provided, modified filenames placed directory. useful paths relative different output directory required. Default NULL.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
text: character vector modified file paths specified prefixes suffixes. original paths preserved names returned vector.

title: Generate modified file paths by adding prefixes and/or suffixes — extend_names
code: # Get all convertible files from examples directory input_files_full <- files_to_convert(penguins_examples_dir(), full.names = TRUE)  # Generate output paths with "_converted" suffix extend_names(input_files_full, suffix = "_converted") #>             /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd  #> "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins_converted.qmd"  #>                        /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R  #>            "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins_converted.R"   # Generate output paths in a specific directory, with relative paths as input input_files <- files_to_convert(penguins_examples_dir()) extend_names(input_files, dir = "new_dir") # relative output paths #>               analysis/penguins.qmd                          penguins.R  #> "new_dir/analysis/penguins_new.qmd"            "new_dir/penguins_new.R"  extend_names(input_files, dir = tempdir()) # absolute output paths #>                       analysis/penguins.qmd  #> "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/analysis/penguins_new.qmd"  #>                                  penguins.R  #>            "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/penguins_new.R"   # Add both prefix and suffix and place in a new directory extend_names(   c("analysis.R", "report.qmd"),   prefix = "processed_",   suffix = "_v2",   dir = tempdir() ) # Results in paths like "tempdir/processed_analysis_v2.R" #>                                analysis.R  #> "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/processed_analysis_v2.R"  #>                                report.qmd  #> "/tmp/RtmpsF566S/processed_report_v2.qmd"

what: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: function lists files directory (subdirectories) match specified file extensions. can used helper find files paths pass convert_files() convert_files_inplace(), preview files functions, well convert_dir() convert_dir_inplace() look convert. can also used input extend_names() help generate output paths new files.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
code: files_to_convert(   dir,   full.names = FALSE,   extensions = c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd") )

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: dir character string specifying directory path search full.names Logical. TRUE, returns full file paths rather relative paths. Default FALSE. extensions character vector file extensions filter . Default c("R", "r", "qmd", "rmd", "Rmd"). NULL empty, returns files.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
text: character vector file paths match specified extensions.

title: List files to convert in a directory — files_to_convert
code: example_dir <- penguins_examples_dir() # Get examples directory files_to_convert(example_dir) #> [1] "analysis/penguins.qmd" "penguins.R"            files_to_convert(example_dir, full.names = TRUE) #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd" #> [2] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R"            files_to_convert(example_dir, extensions = "R") #> [1] "penguins.R" files_to_convert(example_dir, extensions = NULL) # all files #> [1] "analysis/penguins.qmd" "penguins.R"

what: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
text: functions provides access example files included basepenguins package. penguins_examples() called path = NULL, lists available example files. called specific path, returns full path file.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
code: penguins_examples(path = NULL, recursive = FALSE, full.names = FALSE)  penguins_examples_dir()

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
text: path Character string. NULL (default), lists available example files. specified, returns full path specified file directory. recursive Logical. TRUE, lists files subdirectories recursively. used path = NULL. Default FALSE. full.names Logical. TRUE, returns full file paths rather relative paths. used path = NULL. Default FALSE.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
text: penguins_examples: path = NULL, returns character vector available file/directory names. path specified, returns full file path requested resource. penguins_examples_dir: path directory containing examples.

title: List or find example files from basepenguins package — penguins_examples
code: # List all files and directories in the root directory penguins_examples() #> [1] "analysis"   "penguins.R" penguins_examples(recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "analysis/penguins.qmd" "penguins.R"             # Get the full path to a specific example files penguins_examples("penguins.R") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/penguins.R" penguins_examples("analysis/penguins.qmd") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata/analysis/penguins.qmd"  # Get the path to all examples penguins_examples_dir() #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/basepenguins/extdata"
